net.corda.core.observable

Class Observables

  • net.corda.core.observable.Observables

  • public class Observables

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> NonExistentClass continueOnError(NonExistentClass $receiver)
      Observable.continueOnError is used to return an Observable, through which we can subscribe non unsubscribing rx.Observers to the source Observable. Namely, it makes the rx.Observers resilient to exceptions coming out of rx.Observer.onNext.

    • Method Detail

      • continueOnError

        public static <T> NonExistentClass continueOnError(NonExistentClass $receiver)

        Observable.continueOnError is used to return an Observable, through which we can subscribe non unsubscribing rx.Observers to the source Observable. Namely, it makes the rx.Observers resilient to exceptions coming out of rx.Observer.onNext.

        Observable.continueOnError should be called before every subscribe to have the aforementioned effect.

        See Also:
        Observable.continueOnError, rx.Observer, Observable, rx.Observer, rx.Observer.onNext, Observable.continueOnError
